title: Samsung Starts Offering Fix for Faulty Fingerprint Locks on Galaxy S10
text:
The move came less than a week after some users raised complaints that anyone can unlock their phones by fitting a cheap screen protector.

Samsung on Wednesday began offering a software update to fix a flaw related to the fingerprint-access lock of its latest flagship phones, the Galaxy S10 and Note 10.

Samsung apologized for "inconveniences" caused by the problem and pledged to offer the update gradually over a period of 24 hours to keep networks from crashing.

But IT industry sources said Samsung's response has been too slow. Banks and other financial institutions in some countries like the U.K., Israel and China have already taken steps to block access to their systems by users of the Galaxy S10 and Note 10.

Eventually the problem will be solved through the update, but Samsung's image has already been dented. Furthermore, market watchers do not expect consumers to forget the episode any time soon, believing they will no longer blindly believe IT companies' claims about super-duper new technologies.

One industry insider said, "We may end up seeing widespread doubts over biometric technologies in general."
description: Samsung Starts Offering Fix for Faulty Fingerprint Locks on Galaxy S10
